@3592: “法无授权不可为”只适用于政府。

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Everything_which_is_not_forbidden_is_allowed
"Everything which is not forbidden is allowed" is a constitutional principle of English law—an essential freedom of the ordinary citizen or subject.
The converse principle—"everything which is not allowed is forbidden"—used to apply to public authorities, whose actions were limited to the powers explicitly granted to them by law.
